predicate.note: Frames file for 'imprision' based on sentences in wsj. No Verbnet entry, probably should be in 9.10.

example.name: active transitive
example.text: And in a case filed in federal court in August, a lawyer is arguing that Missouri authorities are wrongfully imprisoning the fetus of a pregnant woman who is in jail for theft and forgery.
example.arg: the fetus of a pregnant woman who is in jail for theft and forgery

example.name: passive transitive
example.text: In the port of Berbera, for example, hundreds of men of the rival Issak clan were rounded up in May 1988, imprisoned [*-2], and then taken out at night in groups of five to 50 men to be executed without any judicial process whatsoever.
example.arg: [*-2] -> hundreds of men of the rival Issak clan

example.name: with term
example.text: If convicted, he could be imprisoned [*-1] for up to 10 years and fined $250,000.

example.name: with crime
example.text: [*-2] Imprisoned [*-3] by the Nazis during World War II for his political beliefs, Mr. Honecker typified the postwar generation of committed Communist leaders in Eastern Europe who took their cues from Moscow.
